IKP EDEN is hosting an engaging panel discussion and a networking session at the intersection of science, capital, and entrepreneurship.
Guests:
Roopan Aulakh (pi Ventures)
Suraj Nair (Ankur Capital)
Aridni Shah (immunitoAI)
Kshitij Rishi (4baseCare)
Moderator - Amandeep Singh, Ph.D.

Whether you‚Äôre a researcher-turned-founder, an operator ready to start your own venture, or a VC looking to support high-potential startups, this conversation will dive into the realities of launching and scaling in the life sciences.

The expert panel will share practical insights on: 
‚Ä¢ Raising capital in today‚Äôs bio funding climate 
‚Ä¢ Building the right team and scientific vision from day one 
‚Ä¢ Navigating the translational gap between research and product 
‚Ä¢ What investors are really looking for at each stage 
‚Ä¢ Lessons learned from both successful exits and painful pivots

Expect candid stories, actionable takeaways, and an audience of peers equally passionate about transforming science into impact.

Who should attend: Early-stage and aspiring bio founders, venture capitalists, industry executives, and anyone interested in the future of biotech, medtech, and life sciences innovation.

Registration link - https://lnkd.in/gnVy9rZn

Maps: https://lnkd.in/gdHKcC6k

Following World Zoonoses Day observed on July 6th, we‚Äôre spotlighting dengue ‚Äî one of the fastest-growing mosquito-borne diseases globally, with over ùüî.ùüï ùê¶ùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêúùêöùê¨ùêûùê¨ reported in 2023 alone as per World Health Organization.

From climate change to rapid urbanisation, the spread of zoonotic diseases calls for a united response rooted in science, innovation, and collaboration.

At IKP, we're not just observing zoonotic threats‚Äîwe‚Äôre supporting solutions that reaffirm our commitment to climate-smart health systems and global collaborations where surveillance, science, and startups converge.

Let's innovate to prevent.

To collaborate with us, write to: engage@ikpknowledgepark.com 

And don't forget to follow IKP for more on health, science, and impact.

#BIRAC, through the @National Biopharma Mission (NBM), organized a one day Stakeholders‚Äô Meet on ‚ÄúNovel Therapeutics and Vaccines: Accelerating Transformative Biopharma Innovation in India for Global Health‚Äù, New Delhi. The meeting was chaired by Dr. Jitendra Kumar, Managing Director, BIRAC.

Dr. Raj K Shirumalla, Mission Director, NBM, highlighted NBM‚Äôs role in catalysing development of over 75 biotech products and supporting 220+ grantees, including critical contributions during COVID-19. He urged mission-driven collaboration to position India as a global biotech innovation leader.

Dr. Jyoti Malik Logani, Scientist F, DBT highlighted NBM‚Äôs evolution as BIRAC‚Äôs flagship, World Bank-supported mission to build a resilient innovation ecosystem. She emphasized the leadership‚Äôs 
commitment to strengthening domestic biomanufacturing. 

Dr. Jitendra Kumar emphasized scaling up R&D, fostering deep tech innovation, and building a skilled biotech workforce through global best practices. He called for bold investments to position India as a global biotech leader.

The meeting engaged in a deep-dive discussion on the critical gaps impeding the accelerated development of novel biologics in India. It culminated in a set of forward-looking, globally benchmarked solutions designed to catalyze transformative innovation across the biopharma ecosystem.

The¬†event¬†saw¬†active¬†participation¬†from¬†distinguished¬†stakeholders from Industry, start-ups, academia, etc. 

Jitendra Kumar | Department of Biotechnology | Dr. Raj K Shirumalla | Dr. Jyoti Malik Logani, Scientist F, DBT | Madhvi Rao | Madhu Puri, Ph. D. | Pooja Tanwer, PhD | Vibhor Khar | Suyash Srivastava | Himanshu Yadav 

Nitin Deshmukh | Murali Ramachandra | Dr.¬†Saurabh¬†Joshi,¬†SPARC¬†| Dr.¬†Sanjay¬†Singh,¬†CEO,¬†Gennova¬†Biopharmaceuticals¬†Ltd.¬†| Amulya  K Panda | Dr Shirshendu Mukherjee | Dr.¬†Arjun¬†Surya,¬†CEO,¬†Curadev¬†Pharma¬†Pvt.¬†Ltd.¬†| Vishal Warke | Rajat Goyal | Pushpa Vijayaraghavan | Jayanta Bhattacharya |  Anand Govindaluri | Tathagata Mukherjee | Abhishek Mathur, PhD, MBA | Dr.¬†Amit¬†Awasthi,¬†Sr.¬†Professor,¬†THSTI | Anurag Rathore | Anand Khedkar | Maloy Ghosh 

NBM, BIRAC remains committed to fostering innovation-driven partnerships that will shape the future of¬†India‚Äôs biopharma sector for global impact.
¬†

Marking #WorldBioproductDay the #BioE3 way. üå± #BIRAC‚Äôs Commitment towards a #sustainable #future

In the presence of Dr Jitendra Singh, Rajesh Gokhale, Alka Sharma Dbt and Jitendra Kumar, Stakeholders, Innovators, Academic Institutions and State Representatives across the biotech ecosystem came together to pledge on strengthening India‚Äôs commitment in building a sustainable, inclusive and innovation driven Bioeconomy focused on environmental conservation, economic opportunity and employment generation aligned with the ambitious BioE3 policy.

A shared vision towards sustainable growth and #innovation.

#BIRAC #Bioeconomy #Biomanufacturing #CircularEconomy #Gujarat #JammuKashmir #Assam #WorldBioproductDay2025 #MakeinIndia #ViksitBharat2047 

Department of Biotechnology

On #WorldBioproductDay 2025, the ‚ÄòOne Nation, One Day, One Hour per City‚Äô dialogue series brought together powerful voices to shape the future of India‚Äôs bioeconomy.

BIRAC led a compelling session on Industry‚ÄìAcademia partnerships ‚Äî a cornerstone of India's thriving biotech landscape. With the esteemed presence of Hon‚Äôble Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh, DBT Secretary Dr. Rajesh Gokhale, BIRAC MD Dr. Jitendra Kumar and Dr. Alka Sharma the dialogue emphasized innovation, collaboration, and the collective drive toward sustainable growth.

The session concluded with Dr Jitendra Singh reaffirming India's ambition to become the torchbearer of a Green Revolution Ecosystem ‚Äî one powered by biomanufacturing, circular economy principles, and the transformative vision of the BioE3 policy.

This year, the spotlight was on some of India‚Äôs most promising biotech startups, nurtured by BIRAC and supported through BioNEST incubators.

üî¨ ImmunoACT ‚Äì Dr. Shirish Arya
Developed India‚Äôs first homegrown CAR-T cell therapy, revolutionizing cancer treatment.

üç¨ Revelations Biotech Pvt. Ltd. ‚Äì Dr. Beeram Ravi Chandra 
Introduced the world‚Äôs first low-cost, indigenous sugar substitutes.

üß™ KCAT ENZYMATIC PRIVATE LIMITED  ‚Äì Dr. Pravin kumar
Crafting enzyme technologies to address industrial, medical, and environmental issues.

ü©π Fibroheal Woundcare Pvt Ltd ‚Äì Dr. Vivek Mishra
Invented FIBROPLUG, a patented wound-care solution that ensures rapid clotting and protection.

üß´ OmniBRx Biotechnologies Pvt Ltd - Ravindra Patel 
Pioneering cost-efficient bioreactor platforms for vaccines and biologics.

üå± Cell Biology & Hydroponics ‚Äì Dr. Vishal Warke
Driving advanced R&D in affordable serum-free, chemically defined media and feed supplements for therapeutic proteins.

üåæ Balrampur Chini Mills Limited ‚Äì Ms. Avantika Saraogi 
Spearheading India‚Äôs first PLA bioplastics plant ‚Äî a leap toward green, renewable, and circular biomanufacturing.

üì¢ The event also featured dynamic Student Innovator Pitches:

Sudhanshu Kumar, Chinmoy Dan, Ishika Roy ‚Äî BioBulb: A microalgae-powered device that purifies air by removing CO‚ÇÇ and airborne toxins.

Vaishnavi Sharma ‚Äî A sustainable solution using biochar from fruit peels to remove heavy metals from wastewater.

Together, these voices, innovations, and commitments are powering India's bio-revolution ‚Äî the BioE3 Way.

Jitendra Kumar I Chhaya Chauhan I Dr. Sujit Das I Kanupriya Vashishth

C-CAMP startup Dozee Health has achieved a major global regulatory milestone: CE Mark under the European Union's Medical Device Regulation (EU MDR 2017/745).

The CE Mark signifies that the device meets essential safety, performance, and quality standards required for legal sale within the European Economic Area (EEA), opening access to over 30 countries.

Dozee, supported through the CCAMP Technology Impact Programme, is a pioneer in contactless patient vital monitoring and early warning systems for step-down ICUs and HDUs.

The patient remote monitoring system offers
*Information on all vitals - ECG, Heart Rate, Respiration Rate, Body Temperature, SpO2 and Cuffless BP Trend 
*Continuous monitoring for analysis 
*Cardiac diagnostics for clinical settings and home care

Read more: https://lnkd.in/gcGXa-sS

Startup Exploration Program ‚Äì designed to help you transition from prototype to a validated, market-ready solution.

If you're an innovator seeking structured guidance, expert mentorship, and access to a thriving ecosystem‚Äîthis program is made for you!

‚ú® Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll gain from the program:

‚úÖ Expert Mentorship & Capacity Building: Personalized guidance from seasoned entrepreneurs, domain experts, and industry leaders.
‚úÖ Business Model Validation & Market Strategy: Sharpen your business model and build a solid go-to-market plan with expert feedback.

IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized a focused workshop titled Investment Outreach‚Äô for its incubated startups, led by Vikrant Potnis, Founder of Fundenable, for a deep-dive session into the realities of fundraising and startup scale-up in India. With a rich background in investment banking and venture capital, Vikrant shared powerful insights on:

 ‚úîÔ∏è Fundability
 ‚úîÔ∏è Technical process
 ‚úîÔ∏è Investor access

üîç He also presented case studies from successful Fundenable portfolio startups like EMotorad, WorkIndia, and SuperBottoms, illustrating how strategic funding and strong execution drive exponential growth.

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | 

#BusinessModelCanvas #StartupAcceleration #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #EarlyStageStartups #BuildMeasureLearn #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #StartupSupport #StrategyExecution #ThankYou

Thrilled to see Sound Hub Denmark backing trailblazing #soundtech and #deeptech innovations like Backyard Creators through their latest investment!

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we‚Äôve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support‚Äîaccess to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital‚Äîcan shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

Kudos to Sound Hub Denmark for amplifying the sound of the future‚Äîquite literally! üîä

 #StartupFunding #Deeptech #DERBIFoundation #GlobalInnovation #StartupEcosystem #SoundInnovation

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | HDFC Bank Parivartan | Raman Radhakrishnan | Lakshmanan Radhakrishnan | MeitY Startup Hub | Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) | Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade | Startup India | India DST |

üéì Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! üß†üöÄ

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation‚Äôs lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! üå±üí°

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Daamini Sharma | Dr. Adithya Hande
Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering Bangalore | Dayananda Sagar Institutions | Don Bosco Institute of Technology (DBIT), Bengaluru

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Work In Progress ‚Äì July 2025 edition is here! 

This month, we spotlight innovation that shows up in many forms‚Äîquiet pilots, policy dialogues, and global collaborations. 

From linking biogas systems to global carbon markets to grassroots workshops on soil resilience, to deep-tech solutions making their mark across Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East‚Äîthis edition captures the steady convergence of ideas, communities, and systems. 

You‚Äôll find start-ups shaping climate-resilient agriculture, ocean sustainability, dignified health access, and decentralised energy. You'll also see how IP milestones, field demos, and cross-sector partnerships are laying the foundation for future scale. 

Explore these stories of layered progress‚Äîand the people making it possible. 

Subscribe to receive future editions: https://lnkd.in/gw6bPWVh
¬† ¬†
Explore past editions: https://lnkd.in/gh4aF9cq¬† 

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Smita Rakesh | Dr Kavita Singh | Neeraj Jain | Harish Hande 

#WorkInProgress #InvestedInImpact #InnovationForImpact

Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

Ready-to-Use Labs, Offices, and Desks and much more at India's largest incubator for science and technology based startups! Come.... ùó∂ùóªùó∞ùòÇùóØùóÆùòÅùó≤ ùòÑùó∂ùòÅùóµ ùòÇùòÄ!

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our ùó•ùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóúùóªùó∞ùòÇùóØùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóøùóºùó¥ùóøùóÆùó∫ for startups offers a range of benefits‚Äîwithout taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey. 

ùóñùóºùóªùòÅùóÆùó∞ùòÅ ùòÇùòÄ ùòÅùóºùó±ùóÆùòÜ! We're looking for startups with an innovative idea or technology in the early stages with a scalable business model!

Premnath Venugopalan Manisha Premnath Soma Chattopadhyay Misaal B. Gayathry S Amruta Gore Dr. Mugdha Potnis-Lele Smita Kale Neha Jacob

Delighted to welcome Envalior as our latest CSR partner! 

Venture Center and Envalior have signed an MoU to launch the 'ùóòùóªùòÉùóÆùóπùó∂ùóºùóø ùó¶ùòÇùòÄùòÅùóÆùó∂ùóªùóÆùóØùó∂ùóπùó∂ùòÅùòÜ ùóúùóªùóªùóºùòÉùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóøùóºùó¥ùóøùóÆùó∫, a new initiative to support early-stage startups working in clean energy, circular economy, carbon capture, climate action, and green mobility. 

The program will offer non-dilutive grants, expert mentoring, and technical support to help innovators strengthen prototypes, explore market pathways, and demonstrate their technologies in real-world settings. 

ùóßùòÑùóº ùòÅùòÜùóΩùó≤ùòÄ ùóºùó≥ ùó¥ùóøùóÆùóªùòÅùòÄ ùòÑùó∂ùóπùóπ ùóØùó≤ ùóºùó≥ùó≥ùó≤ùóøùó≤ùó±:   

1. Technology Advancement Grants (‚Çπ10 lakh): to refine prototypes and assess markets.
2. Pilot Grants (‚Çπ5 lakh): for field trials and pilot demonstrations

The initiative also aims to build a strong ecosystem of mentors, investors, and service providers to help startups grow sustainably.

The MoU was signed earlier today, and we were delighted to host the team from Envalior at Venture Center ‚Äî Sainath Vaidya, Ph.D., Hema Rani, Sagar Shelar, Disha Rohra, Chinmay Saraf. Together, we hope to seed a pipeline of impactful technologies, create entrepreneurial opportunities, and contribute meaningfully to India‚Äôs climate goals.

üì¢ The first call for applications will be announced soon. Stay tuned!

Premnath Venugopalan Soma Chattopadhyay Neha Jacob Namita Joshi Shruti Devasthali Nileshkumar Kukalyekar 

#cleanenergy #circulareconomy #carboncapture #climateaction #greenmobility #csr #grantfunding #startup

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders who‚Äôve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.

#Innovation #Entrepreneurship #3DPrinting #StartupCulture #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupIndia #DesignToPrototype #Founders #TeamBuilding

At DST Prayas Shala: Where Ideas Take Shape, we provide innovators and early-stage startups with advanced prototyping infrastructure and specialized technical support.

Our makerspace at Ahmedabad University bridges the gap between concept and market-ready products through sophisticated design and fabrication capabilities. We enable rapid prototyping cycles that help entrepreneurs validate ideas and accelerate time-to-market.

Ready to transform your hardware innovation into reality? Connect with our team to explore how DST Prayas Shala can support your venture.

#Innovation #StartupSupport #PrototypingLab #HardwareDevelopment #AhmedabadUniversity

Inside Bio-NEST, where Innovation meets infrastructure. Ever wondered how biotech ideas turn into real-world solutions? At Bio-NEST, Ahmedabad University, startups get access to high-end tools, expert support, and a vibrant community.

Peek into one of our core instruments, a lyophilized, used to extend product shelf life in biopharma, food, and cosmetics without damaging properties.

Whether you're building in health, agri, or industrial biotech, Bio-NEST offers:
‚úÖ Cutting-edge lab equipment
‚úÖ Custom support for early-stage ventures
‚úÖ A thriving network of innovators

Empowering Robotics Founders with Legal Acumen.

The Robotics founders of #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1 had an insightful session on the legal foundations of startup building, conducted by Ankita Singh (Founder) and Yash Vardhan Singh (Counsel) from Sarvaank Associates.

From IP rights and contract structuring to founder agreements and compliance basics ‚Äî the session demystified complex legal concepts that are crucial for Deep Tech startups transitioning from prototype to market.

üôè A big thank you to Ankita and Yash Vardhan for empowering our founders with the legal knowledge they need to scale with confidence.

#ProtoQuikLaunchpad #iCreateWithYou #RoboticsFounders #StartupLaw #DeepTechStartups #LegalForInnovation #FoundersFirst

As part of the ProtoQuik Launchpad, iCreate hosted a virtual session with senior officials from the Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB), exploring real-world deployment opportunities for Robotics solutions in environmental management.

The discussion focused on real-world use cases ‚Äî from cleaning lakes and beaches to accessing hazardous sites, inspecting pipelines, and navigating confined spaces where human intervention is difficult. GPCB officials shared their perspective on how such technologies can enhance operational efficiency and safety in environmental monitoring and waste management.

Our Robotics startups presented their prototypes, initiating a meaningful dialogue on potential field trials with GPCB‚Äôs support.

We thank Shri. D. M. Thaker, Member Secretary, GPCB and Sr. Officials from GPCB, Shri. Agrawat, Shri Niraj Shah, Shri T.C. Patel, and Shri Ashvin Mistry for their time, insights, and encouragement.

Brilliant ideas often remain confined to the lab. The real challenge lies in taking them into the market, where they can solve real-world problems at scale.

ProtoQuik Launchpad is designed to bridge that gap helping founders transform R&D into measurable ROI with the right mentorship, resources, and momentum to turn prototypes into products.
